content: The event featured Olympic and Sprint categories, and followed the endurance-based Run‚ÄìCycle‚ÄìRun format

content: It was a truly moving to see the poorest and most exploited Adivasi and other peasants of the country celebrate Republic Day in the midst of a continuing massive struggle

title: 9,550 kg of explosives seized in Rajasthan, man arrested; Central agencies likely to get involved
content: Besides ammonium nitrate, police also seized a large quantity of explosive accessories, including nine cartons of detonators, 12 cartons and 15 bundles of blue fuse wire, and 12 cartons and five bundles of red fuse wire, officials said

title: Telangana‚Äôs stunning rise and its unhinged growth
content: However, data on this achievement point to the need for policies to be formulated to spread the fruits of growth across the State

title: Noida techie death: The road that ended in a tragedy
content: On a dark fog-ridden January night in Greater Noida, a water-filled construction pit ‚Äî unmarked and unfenced ‚Äî became a fatal trap. Yuvraj Mehta, a 27-year-old techie, accidentally drove into it and died. The incident has become more than a personal tragedy, turning into an indictment of a city built ‚Äî and sold ‚Äî faster than ground realities can keep pace, finds Shrimansi Kaushik. Residents say neglect and institutional apathy have turned urban spaces into landscapes of loss

title: 'Successful India makes world more stable': EU chief's post R-Day parade message
content: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen stated that a successful India contributes to global stability, prosperity, and security. She, along with European Council president Antonio Costa, were the first joint EU leaders to attend India's Republic Day parade as chief guests. Their visit precedes an India-EU summit focused on trade, security, and strategic cooperation.

title: BrahMos to S-400: Weapon systems from Operation Sindoor take centre stage at R-Day parade
content: India's Republic Day 2026 parade showcased its military might, highlighting the success of Operation Sindoor, a counterterror action that neutralized over 100 terrorists and enemy soldiers. The display featured advanced weapons platforms like the BrahMos missile and S-400 air defence system, emphasizing combat readiness and technological prowess in multi-domain warfare.

title: ‚ÄòLost interest‚Äô: Days after President‚Äôs Delhi visit, UAE scraps its airport deal with Pakistan
content: Abu Dhabi has reportedly scrapped its airport management deal with Pakistan, citing a failure to find a local partner. This comes as Pakistan strengthens defense ties with Saudi Arabia, while the UAE deepens its strategic partnership with India, signing multiple agreements during President Mohamed bin Zayed's recent New Delhi visit.

title: Microsoft and Amazon take out full-page ad, warn Washington faces ‚Äòemergency‚Äô
content: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have joined forces to tackle Washington State's severe housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an op-ed, pledging $1.6 billion to build over 26,000 affordable homes for the community. They urge policymakers to prioritize policies that simplify and expedite construction, warning that inaction risks further economic decline and talent loss.

title: Oracle cofounder Larry Ellison warns of the biggest flaw in AI models like ChatGPT and Gemini
content: Oracle's Larry Ellison believes the AI race is becoming a commodity due to shared internet data. He argues the future lies in leveraging private enterprise data, a move Oracle is heavily investing in with massive infrastructure plans.  While competitors are also building enterprise AI, Oracle's existing database dominance could be key to its success in this next AI wave.

title: Speeding SUVs, stunts and swagger: How reckless driving put innocent lives at risk
content: Indian urban streets are increasingly theatres of risk due to reckless driving, with incidents ranging from dangerous swerving on highways to high-speed stunts and wrong-side driving. While enforcement is present, a decline in civic sense and infrastructure issues amplify dangers, making road safety a national challenge.

title: Carrying father's dream, inspired by Gayle: USA cricketer Nitish Sudini eyes MLC
content: Vikram Reddy Sudini's unfulfilled cricket dream found new life through his son, Nitish. The 18-year-old made history by becoming the first USA player to score an Under-19 World Cup century, remaining unbeaten on 117 against New Zealand. This achievement fulfilled his father's long-held aspiration, with Nitish now aiming to represent the USA senior team.

title: ‚ÄòRivals will be completely destroyed‚Äô: Ex-cricketer warns world as India look unbeatable
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan believes the current Indian T20 side is "almost impossible to beat" following their dominant series win against New Zealand. Pathan highlighted the team's fearless, ultra-aggressive batting approach, which he feels intimidates rivals and leaves them with "no margin for error" ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: Microsoft tells engineers to use Claude Code and GitHub Copilot, report which works better
content: Microsoft is having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in Anthropic's AI coding tools, even as Copilot remains its flagship enterprise product. The company is encouraging experimentation across various teams, reflecting a pragmatic approach to leveraging multiple AI tools for optimal software development.

title: Who is Nadeem Khan? 'Dhurandhar' actor accused of sexually assaulting domestic help
content: Mumbai Police have taken actor Nadeem Khan into custody following serious allegations of rape from a former domestic employee. The accuser claims that Khan, popular for his portrayal in 'Dhurandhar', misled her with promises of marriage over ten years ago before allegedly renouncing his intentions. The case has now moved to Malvani police, where the initial incident reportedly took place.

title: 'Kicks, punches, sticks, rods': Late-night food delivery mix-up sparks brawl in Greater Noida
content: A food delivery mix-up at Nimbus Society in Greater Noida escalated into a violent brawl involving a delivery agent, his friends, and society security guards. The chaotic clash, triggered by a wrong delivery, saw dozens exchanging blows with sticks and rods near the main gate. Police have registered an FIR and arrested the delivery agent and three guards.

title: 75+ Happy Republic Day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2026
content: As India gears up for its 77th Republic Day in 2026, the nation celebrates its Constitution, the 'Rule Book' uniting 1.4 billion citizens.

title: Founder exit, not failure: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal explains why
content: Shaadi.com founder Anupam Mittal advocates for founders stepping down as CEOs, calling it maturity, not failure. He argues that startups outgrow founders' management skills, necessitating professional leadership for sustained growth.  Globally accepted, this transition is often misconstrued in India as a sign of defeat, Mittal noted.

title: Fatty liver disease: The growing threat you have probably never tested for
content: Fatty liver, now termed MASLD, is rapidly spreading in India, driven by lifestyle factors like poor diet and inactivity, not just alcohol. Affecting one in three adults, it often presents with no early symptoms, making proactive screening crucial. Reversal is possible through sustained lifestyle changes, including diet, exercise, and weight management.

title: Republic Day: Sports fraternity says 'let us honour our Constitution'
content: Members of the Indian sports fraternity extended Republic Day greetings on social media, emphasizing the importance of the Constitution, unity, and national duty. Athletes and sports bodies shared messages on platforms like X and Instagram, celebrating India's 77th Republic Day and expressing pride in their nation.

title: Stocks to buy: What's the outlook for Nifty for Budget 2026 week? Check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Sudeep Shah, Head of SBI Securities recommends buying  Hindustan Unilever, and Ashok Leyland as top stock picks. He shares his view on Nifty, Bank Nifty for the Budget 2026 trading week starting January 27, 2026:

title: Stopped at gate, gig worker returns with group, attacks security guards in Hyderabad
content: Gig workers allegedly attacked security guards at a Hyderabad gated community after one delivery boy was stopped as per protocol. The group returned hours later and brutally beat the guards, with one requiring hospitalization. Police have registered a case and are searching for the accused.

title: Colonel Rajeev Bharwan (Retd.) on defence-based films: Intent matters more than impact
content: Retired Army Officer Colonel Rajeev Bharwan critiques the commercialization of patriotic films, emphasizing that authenticity and genuine intent are paramount. He argues that films should focus on the real sacrifices of soldiers rather than relying on cinematic embellishments.

title: Murder in Mumbai local: How cameras with facial tech traced teacher‚Äôs killer in 12 hours
content: In a remarkable display of technology's capability, facial recognition played a crucial role in the swift arrest of a suspect linked to the tragic murder of a college teacher in Mumbai. Just 12 hours post-incident at Malad station, authorities successfully identified and apprehended Omkar Shinde. The suspect reportedly attacked the victim following a minor disagreement onboard a local train.

title: What is the Discombobulator that Trump is 'not allowed to talk about'?
content: Former President Trump revealed a secret weapon, the 'discombobulator,' was key to capturing Nicol√°s Maduro.  He claims the device disabled Venezuelan defenses and weaponry during the January 3rd raid, preventing any shots fired or American casualties.  This aligns with reports of incapacitated guards and malfunctioning radar systems during the operation.

title: 'Border 2' collection: After a massive Sunday, Sunny Deol starrer crosses Rs 120cr
content: Border 2 is performing exceptionally well at the box office. The film has collected over Rs 128 crore in just four days. It saw a massive jump on Sunday, mirroring the success of Gadar 2. The movie is expected to benefit further from the Republic Day holiday. Audiences are showing immense enthusiasm for the film.

title: ‚ÄòDhurandhar‚Äô actor held for raping domestic help in Mumbai
content: In a shocking turn of events, Nadeem Khan, the Mumbai actor celebrated for his role in 'Dhurandhar', has been taken into custody following serious allegations of rape against his former domestic worker spanning over a decade. The 41-year-old victim asserts that Khan had led her to believe in a future together, only to later abandon those promises.

title: Exclusive: Shreyas to stay with T20I team as Tilak's return delayed - IND vs NZ
content: Shreyas Iyer will continue to be with India T20I team for the remaining two T20Is vs New Zealand as Tilak Varma's return to competitive cricket has been delayed. Iyer was initially picked for only the first three games but will now continue to be with the side for remainder of the series.

title: Out for stroll at 3am, woman dragged into Aravalis near Leopard Trail, ‚Äòsexually assaulted‚Äô
content: A woman was allegedly sexually assaulted near Leopard Trail in the Aravalis early Saturday morning after a man snatched her phone and lured her into a forested area. Her friend's attempt to intervene was unsuccessful. Police apprehended a suspect, Gaurav Bhati, and the victim received medical attention. Her condition is reported as stable.

title: 77th Republic Day: PM Modi dons maroon-yellow Rajasthani safa with zari motifs
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's red Rajasthani turban, adorned with golden-yellow streaks, captivated onlookers at the 77th Republic Day parade. This distinctive headwear, a recurring signature, symbolizes India's rich cultural tapestry and regional heritage.  Paired with a navy kurta-pyjama and light blue Nehru jacket, his attire blended formal elegance with cultural pride, complementing the grandeur of the national celebration.

title: India marks 77th R-Day: Culture ministry tableau celebrates legacy of Vande Mataram ‚Äî key points
content: President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi presided over the main ceremony at Kartavya Path in the national capital. The President of the European Council, Antonio Costa, and the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, also attended the celebrations as chief guests. Kartavya Path, which runs from Rashtrapati Bhavan to the National War Memorial, was extensively decorated to reflect India‚Äôs journey over the years.

title: 'People gave me six months': Jasprit Bumrah opens up on 10-year international journey
content: India secured the T20I series with two games remaining. Jasprit Bumrah stated his focus is on team contribution, not ball preference. He delivered a strong performance with three wickets. Abhishek Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav led the chase with powerful batting. Bumrah also marked ten years in international cricket, reflecting on his journey.

title: 'It's not just an award but responsibility': Actor R. Madhavan honoured with Padma Shri 2026
content: In a moment to cherish, actor R. Madhavan has been bestowed with the Padma Shri, a recognition he sees not just as an honor but as a significant obligation. He committed to embodying the award's ideals with grace and dedication.

title: Watch: Mi-17 choppers shower petals, fly ‚ÄòDhwaj Formation‚Äô
content: Republic Day celebrations commenced with a breathtaking 'Dhwaj Formation' by Mi-17 helicopters, showering petals over Kartavya Path. Lieutenant General Bhavnish Kumar led the parade, followed by recipients of India's highest gallantry awards. The event highlighted India's progress, military might, and cultural diversity, marking the adoption of the Constitution.

title: ‚ÄòHis heart is still in India‚Äô: Late Mestvirishvili first foreign coach to get Padma Shri
content: Legendary wrestling coach Vladimir Mestvirishvili, affectionately known as ‚ÄòLaado‚Äô in India, has been posthumously awarded the Padma Shri. His son, Shalva, expressed overwhelming emotion and gratitude, highlighting his father's deep connection with India and its wrestlers. Vladimir, instrumental in shaping India's freestyle wrestling talent, becomes the first foreign coach to receive this prestigious honour.

title: India marks 77th republic day: Who are the chief guests?
content: India celebrates its 77th Republic Day with a grand parade on Kartavya Path, showcasing military might and cultural diversity. European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen and European Council president Ant√≥nio Costa are this years chief guests, highlighting a deepening strategic partnership. Discussions on a crucial free trade agreement and a new security pact are underway, underscoring strong India-EU ties.

title: Winter storm in US: Private jet carrying 8 passengers crashes at Maine airport
content: A private Bombardier Challenger 600 jet crashed during takeoff at Bangor International Airport in Maine on Sunday night, carrying eight people. The incident occurred amid a severe winter storm battering the eastern United States, disrupting air travel nationwide. Federal authorities, including the FAA and NTSB, have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash.

title: Padma awards 2026 for Dharmendra, Shibu Soren, cricketers Harmanpreet Kaur, Rohit Sharma
content: The Padma Awards 2024 celebrated a remarkable 131 honorees, including icons like Dharmendra and the late V S Achuthanandhan, alongside sports stars Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur, and cinematic legend Mammootty. This year's recognition extends to the unsung heroes from various fields and remote areas, with 10 districts making their award debut.

title: 150 Years of 'Vande Mataram' at Republic Day Parade today
content: Republic Day celebrations at Kartavya Path will highlight the 150th anniversary of the national song 'Vande Mataram'. The event will showcase India's developmental progress, military strength, and cultural diversity, with tableaux themed around 'Swatantrata ka Mantra: Vande Mataram' and 'Samriddhi ka Mantra: Aatmanirbhar Bharat'.

title: Leaked audio: Did Navarro, Vance block India trade deal?
content: Senator Ted Cruz was secretly recorded criticizing Vice President JD Vance and mocking President Trump's tariff policy. Cruz warned donors that the tariffs could harm the economy and lead to Trump's impeachment, recounting a heated call with the President. He also accused Vance of being a prot√©g√© of Tucker Carlson, influencing foreign policy appointments.

title: Bomb threat triggers high alert at Ayodhya Ram Temple
content: A bomb threat targeting the Ram Temple in Ayodhya on Saturday night led to heightened security and the detention of a caller from Gonda district. Preliminary inquiries suggest the individual may be mentally unstable and was intoxicated at the time of the call. Authorities are conducting a comprehensive investigation to ascertain the motive and verify the threat's credibility.

title: ‚ÄòNot going to challenge‚Äô: BCB accepts ICC call as Bangladesh bow out quietly of T20 WC
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has accepted the ICC's decision to replace them with Scotland in the T20 World Cup after the government refused to clear the team for travel to India due to security concerns. The BCB stated they cannot participate in the current fixture and will not pursue arbitration.

title: ‚ÄòNo intention‚Äô: Carney rules out free trade pact with China after Trump threatens tariffs
content: Canada's prime minister Mark Carney denies plans for a free trade deal with China. This comes after US President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on Canadian goods. Carney affirmed Canada's commitment to the CUSMA agreement, which restricts such deals with non-market economies without prior notice. Carney said recent engagements with China focused on resolving existing tariff disputes, not broader trade pacts.

title: Warm-up tie to check Washington backup? SA or India ‚ÄòA‚Äô emerge as likely opponents
content: India's T20 World Cup squad is planning a practice match on February 4 due to injury concerns for Washington Sundar and Tilak Varma. Selectors are exploring options like playing South Africa or India 'A' players. Riyan Parag is being prepared as a potential backup, with his fitness to be assessed soon.

title: Mexico shooting: 11 killed in armed attack at soccer field in Guanajuato
content: At least 11 people were killed and 12 injured in a soccer field shooting in Salamanca, Guanajuato, on Sunday. Security forces are searching for the perpetrators. The incident occurred in a state already grappling with high homicide rates due to criminal group conflicts.

title: ‚ÄòYou never know‚Äô: Abhishek Sharma flirts with Yuvraj‚Äôs iconic record after blazing knock
content: Abhishek Sharma smashed the second-fastest T20I half-century by an Indian, reaching his fifty in just 14 balls against New Zealand. The explosive opener remained unbeaten on 68 off 20 deliveries, guiding India to an eight-wicket victory. Sharma attributed his fearless approach to team expectations and instinct.

title: HYDRAA rescues nine workers stranded in Mir Alam lake
content: The team was conducting surveys for the construction of the ‚Çπ319.24 crore bridge connecting Shastripuram to Chintalmet in the southern part of Hyderabad

title: Jammu and Kashmir CM asks people to avoid non-essential travel for 3 days amid snowfall forecast
content: CM Abdullah said that Jammu and Kashmir had witnessed a severe drought after December, which has now been broken.

title: Fresh encounter breaks out between security forces, terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs Kishtwar
content: Security forces returned fire, and an intermittent exchange of gunfire was reported as the situation developed, officials said

title: Shibu Soren is and will forever remain 'Bharat Ratna': Jharkhand CM on Padma Bhushan to father
content: A statement from the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha said Shibu Soren should have been conferred with Bharat Ratna, and not Padma Bhushan, and said the demand for Bharat Ratna for him would continue to be raised

content: ‚ÄòThe Last Sky,‚Äô a photo exhibition that opened at the Fine Arts College Gallery, Palayam is open to public daily from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. till January 31. Entry is free.

title: Deworming tablets to be distributed to more than one crore children on February 17
content: Children and adolescents aged between 1 and 19 will be provided ‚Äòalbendazole‚Äô tablets free of cost, says official

title: ‚ÄòAmaravati Bill‚Äô will be introduced in Budget session of Parliament, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: During the Telugu Desam Parliamentary Party meeting, he advises MPs to make efforts to mobilise additional funds from the Centre, desist from picking up conflicts with Telangana on irrigation projects, and refrain from acting in a way that dents alliance‚Äôs objectives

title: All eyes on Governor‚Äôs address
content: Speaking in Mysuru, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said the Governor was free to make changes to the speech provided by the State government while delivering the Republic Day address

title: Democracy bulldozed, federalism attacked: Kharge
content: In a speech on the eve of Republic Day, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge says federalism has become a casualty of the BJP‚Äôs ‚Äòdouble-engine‚Äô governance model, used to disadvantage Opposition-ruled States

title: AIADMK IT Wing calls TVK chief Vijay narcissistic
content: It launches a sharp attack on the actor-politician over his criticism of the AIADMK being a ‚Äúcorrupt party‚Äù and a slave to the Central government

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Winzo and its directors in Bengaluru
content: According to the ED, Winzo operated a real money gaming (RMG) platform offering over 100 games and claimed a user base of around 25 crore, largely from tier-3 and tier-4 cities

title: COAS General Upendra Dwivedi meets U.S. Army Secretary Daniel P. Driscoll in New Delhi
content: The discussions focused on deepening bilateral defence ties, expanding Army-to-Army cooperation, and reinforcing the shared commitment of both forces to global peace and security

title: Assembly election is a battle to defeat forces out to destroy Tamil culture, says CM Stalin

title: TMC, BJP supporters ‚Äòclash‚Äô near Kolkata; makeshift public meeting stage set afire
content: A makeshift stage, where former Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Deb addressed a public meeting in the afternoon, was allegedly set on fire during the clash

title: Government introducing modern Rover technology for mapping lands: Ponguleti
content: Licensed surveyors were being brought directly to the field-level to ensure accurate and transparent land measurements, marking a major shift in the land administration system, Minister said

content: He was about to receive his ninth State Award for his performance in ‚ÄòBramayugam‚Äô (2024), when the news arrived about him being selected for the Padma Bhushan

title: Why feds call former Olympic snowboarder a 'modern-day Pablo Escobar'
content: Ryan Wedding, 44, and his associates allegedly trafficked more than $1 billion in cocaine across the u.s. and Canada . prosecutors laid out how wedding allegedly orchestrated multiple killings, including the assassination of a key government witness . wedding was born into a snow sports family .

title: The Patriots just showed us what it means to hire the right coach
content: the new England Patriots take over late in the AFC Championship game . they beat the texans 10-7 to advance to the super bowl . it's not supposed to happen this fast! teams aren't supposed to miss the playoffs three seasons in a row .

title: Watch: Videos show glimpses from Republic Day Parade flypast ‚Äî seen from IAF's perspective
content: NEW DELHI: The Indian Air Force flypast stole the spotlight at the 77th Republic Day parade, captivating spectators from start to finish. The aerial segment began with a ceremonial flower shower and continued through a series of meticulously coordinated formations showcasing the IAF‚Äôs speed, precision and combat readiness. A total of 29 aircraft participated in this year‚Äôs Republic Day flypast, including 16 fighter jets, four transport aircraft and nine helicopters. The platforms operated out of five different bases, reflecting the scale of planning and coordination involved in executing the aerial display. Following the event, the Indian Air Force shared the IAF perspective videos from the air show and flypast. Four Mi-17 1V helicopters from the 129 Helicopter Unit will conduct the ceremonial showering of flower petals in the Dhwaj Formation. Led by Group Captain Alok Ahlawat, the formation will troop the National Flag as part of the Republic Day aerial segment.
